subject: Business
title: When to Delegate vs. Decide Yourself
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: When to Delegate vs. Decide Yourself.

hook.text: A founder reviews every hire, every expense, every design. The company has 200 employees. They become the bottleneck.

buildup.text: Delegation isn't abdication. It's assigning the right decisions to the people closest to the information.

discovery.text: Amazon's principle: decisions should be made by the person with the most relevant context, not the highest title.

twist.text: Leaders who can't delegate either don't trust their team or haven't built one worth trusting.

climax.text: Decide yourself when the stakes are existential and irreversible. Delegate everything else.

punchline.text: A leader who decides everything decides nothing well.

quiz.question: When should a leader make decisions themselves instead of delegating?
options: When the stakes are existential and the decision is irreversible
